oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1955-10-29 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 29, 1955. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Little Jimmy Dickens (host/performer), guest performers the Wilburn Brothers, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Tommy Jackson, Del Wood, Minnie Pearl, and Chet Atkins. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Little Jimmy Dickens; Rod Brasfield; Wilburn Brothers; Tommy Jackson; Del Wood
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Little Jimmy Dickens -- Salty Boogie (Little Jimmy Dickens) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Little Jimmy Dickens) -- Little Jimmy Dickens introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Little Jimmy Dickens) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Little Jimmy Dickens) -- Little Jimmy Dickens introduces the Wilburn Brothers -- Mixed Up Medley (Wilburn Brothers) -- Little Jimmy Dickens introduces Tommy Jackson -- Grey Eagle (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Little Jimmy Dickens talks -- If I Could Hear My Mother Pray Again (Little Jimmy Dickens) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, Little Jimmy Dickens) -- Prince Albert jingle (Little Jimmy Dickens) -- Little Jimmy Dickens introduces Del Wood -- Rocky Mountain Express (Del Wood) [continued in part 2]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Dickens, Little Jimmy, 1920-; Brasfield, Rod; Wood, Del; Jackson, Tommy; Minnie Pearl; Atkins, Chet; Wilburn Brothers; Wilburn, Teddy; Wilburn, Doyle
